panels.description: Mean Deployment / Release Frequency. How much time passes between two deployments.

targets.cypherQuery:
WITH date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__from}})) AS fromDate, date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__to}})) AS toDate

MATCH (deployment:Deployment)
WHERE date(datetime(deployment.published_at)) >= fromDate AND date(datetime(deployment.published_at)) <= toDate

WITH deployment
ORDER BY deployment.published_at

WITH collect(deployment.published_at) AS deploymentDates

UNWIND range(0, size(deploymentDates) - 2) AS i
WITH deploymentDates[i] AS currentDeployment, deploymentDates[i+1] AS nextDeployment

RETURN percentileCont(duration.inSeconds(datetime(currentDeployment), datetime(nextDeployment)).seconds / 3600.0, 0.5) AS deploymentFrequencyInHours

panels.title: Mean Release Frequency

panels.description: How long the release job runs
panels.title: Release time

panels.description: How long each CI job ran in seconds

targets.cypherQuery:
WITH date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__from}})) AS fromDate, date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__to}})) AS toDate

WITH fromDate, toDate, duration.inDays(fromDate, toDate).days + 1 AS totalDays

UNWIND range(0, totalDays) AS daysToAdd

WITH fromDate + duration({ days: daysToAdd }) as date
WHERE date.weekDay <> 6 AND date.weekDay <> 7

MATCH (m:TwinMetaData)

OPTIONAL MATCH (a:AutomationRun)
WHERE a.name in m.ci_automation_names
AND a.updated_at IS NOT NULL 
AND date(datetime(a.run_started_at)) = date

WITH date,
       CASE 
         WHEN a IS NULL THEN 0  
         ELSE duration.inSeconds(datetime(a.run_started_at), datetime(a.updated_at)).seconds
         END AS runTimeInSeconds

RETURN date, toFloat(percentileCont(runTimeInSeconds, 0.5)/60) as averageRunTimeInMinutes

panels.title: CI Mean Run Time

targets.cypherQuery:
MATCH (m:TwinMetaData)
CALL {
  MATCH (c:Commit)

  WITH c
  LIMIT 1
  
  RETURN c.branch as main_branch
}
MATCH (m:TwinMetaData)

MATCH (run:AutomationRun)
WHERE run.name in m.ci_automation_names
AND run.head_branch = main_branch

WITH date(datetime(run.run_started_at)) AS date, CASE run.conclusion WHEN 'failure' THEN 0 ELSE 1 END AS wasSuccess
WHERE date.weekDay <> 6 AND date.weekDay <> 7

RETURN date, (SUM(wasSuccess) * 100.0 / COUNT(*)) AS successRate
ORDER BY date

WITH date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__from}})) AS fromDate, date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__to}})) AS toDate

MATCH (deployment:Deployment)
WHERE date(datetime(deployment.published_at)) >= fromDate AND date(datetime(deployment.published_at)) <= toDate

WITH deployment
ORDER BY deployment.published_at

WITH collect(deployment.published_at) AS deploymentDates

UNWIND range(0, size(deploymentDates) - 2) AS i
WITH deploymentDates[i] AS currentDeployment, deploymentDates[i+1] AS nextDeployment

RETURN stDev(duration.inSeconds(datetime(currentDeployment), datetime(nextDeployment)).seconds / 3600.0) AS deploymentFrequencyInHours

MATCH (m:TwinMetaData)
MATCH (run:AutomationRun {name: m.deployment_automation_name})

WITH date(datetime(run.run_started_at)) AS date, CASE run.conclusion WHEN 'failure' THEN 0 ELSE 1 END AS wasSuccess

RETURN date, (SUM(wasSuccess) * 100.0 / COUNT(*)) AS successRate
ORDER BY date

panels.description: How long each CI job ran in seconds

targets.cypherQuery:
WITH date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__from}})) AS fromDate, date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__to}})) AS toDate

WITH fromDate, toDate, duration.inDays(fromDate, toDate).days + 1 AS totalDays

UNWIND range(0, totalDays) AS daysToAdd

WITH fromDate + duration({ days: daysToAdd }) as date
WHERE date.weekDay <> 6 AND date.weekDay <> 7

MATCH (m:TwinMetaData)

OPTIONAL MATCH (a:AutomationRun)
WHERE a.name in m.ci_automation_names
AND a.updated_at IS NOT NULL 
AND date(datetime(a.run_started_at)) = date

WITH date,
       CASE 
         WHEN a IS NULL THEN 0  
         ELSE duration.inSeconds(datetime(a.run_started_at), datetime(a.updated_at)).seconds
         END AS runTimeInSeconds

RETURN date, toFloat(percentileCont(runTimeInSeconds, 0.95)/60) as averageRunTimeInMinutes

panels.title: CI 95th Percentile Run Time

targets.cypherQuery:
WITH date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__from}})) AS fromDate, date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__to}})) AS toDate

MATCH (m:TwinMetaData)
WITH fromDate, toDate, m.main_branch as main_branch, m.ci_automation_names as ci_names

MATCH (failedRun:AutomationRun {head_branch: main_branch, conclusion: 'failure'})
WHERE failedRun.name in ci_names
AND date(datetime(failedRun.run_started_at)) > fromDate
AND date(datetime(failedRun.run_started_at)) < toDate

CALL {
WITH failedRun, main_branch, ci_names
MATCH (run:AutomationRun {head_branch: main_branch, conclusion: 'success', name: failedRun.name})
WHERE run.name in ci_names
AND run.run_started_at > failedRun.updated_at

RETURN run
ORDER BY run.updated_at ASC
LIMIT 1
}

WITH run, failedRun
ORDER BY run.updated_at

RETURN date(datetime(run.run_started_at)), duration.inSeconds(datetime(failedRun.updated_at), datetime(run.run_started_at)).seconds/60 as timeToRecoveryInMinutes

panels.description: Lead time in hours per commit. Lead time calculated as time from commit to deploy.

targets.cypherQuery:
WITH date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__from}})) AS fromDate, date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__to}})) AS toDate

MATCH (deployment:Deployment)-[:INITIAL_DEPLOY]->(deployed_commit:Commit)
WHERE date(datetime(deployment.published_at)) >= fromDate AND date(datetime(deployment.published_at)) <= toDate

WITH deployment, deployed_commit
ORDER BY deployment.published_at

RETURN datetime(deployed_commit.date) as date, duration.inSeconds(datetime(deployed_commit.date), datetime(deployment.published_at)).seconds / 3600.0 as leadTimeInHours

panels.title: Lead time (per commit)

targets.cypherQuery:
Match (n:TwinMetaData)
WITH n, properties(n) as node_properties

UNWIND keys(node_properties) AS property_key
RETURN property_key as twin_setting, node_properties[property_key] AS setting_value

panels.description: Mean CI run duration in hh:mm:ss

targets.cypherQuery:
match (m:TwinMetaData)

WITH m.ci_automation_names as ci_names

MATCH (run:AutomationRun)
WHERE run.name in ci_names

RETURN percentileCont(duration.inSeconds(datetime(run.run_started_at), datetime(run.updated_at)).seconds, 0.5)

panels.title: Mean CI run duration

targets.cypherQuery:
WITH date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__from}})) AS fromDate, date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__to}})) AS toDate

MATCH (m:TwinMetaData)
WITH fromDate, toDate, m.main_branch as main_branch, m.ci_automation_names as ci_names

MATCH (failedRun:AutomationRun {head_branch: main_branch, conclusion: 'failure'})
WHERE failedRun.name in ci_names
AND date(datetime(failedRun.run_started_at)) > fromDate
AND date(datetime(failedRun.run_started_at)) < toDate

CALL {
WITH failedRun, main_branch, ci_names
MATCH (run:AutomationRun {head_branch: main_branch, conclusion: 'success', name: failedRun.name})
WHERE run.name in ci_names
AND run.run_started_at > failedRun.updated_at

RETURN run
ORDER BY run.updated_at ASC
LIMIT 1
}

WITH run, failedRun
ORDER BY run.updated_at

RETURN percentileCont(duration.inSeconds(datetime(failedRun.updated_at), datetime(run.run_started_at)).seconds, 0.5)/60 as meanTimeToRecoveryInMinutes

panels.title: CI Mean Time To Recovery (Main Branch)

panels.description: Time from commit to deploy in hours

targets.cypherQuery:
WITH date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__from}})) AS fromDate, date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__to}})) AS toDate

MATCH (deployment:Deployment)-[:INITIAL_DEPLOY]->(deployed_commit:Commit)
WHERE date(datetime(deployment.published_at)) >= fromDate AND date(datetime(deployment.published_at)) <= toDate

WITH deployment, deployed_commit
ORDER BY deployment.published_at

RETURN toFloat(percentileCont(duration.inSeconds(datetime(deployed_commit.date), datetime(deployment.published_at)).seconds, 0.5) / 3600.0) as leadTimeInHours

panels.title: Mean Lead Time

panels.description: Mean test run duration in hh:mm:ss

targets.cypherQuery:
match (m:TwinMetaData)

WITH m.test_automation_names as test_names

MATCH (run:AutomationRun)
WHERE run.name in test_names

RETURN percentileCont(duration.inSeconds(datetime(run.run_started_at), datetime(run.updated_at)).seconds, 0.5)

panels.title: Mean test run duration

targets.cypherQuery:
MATCH (m:TwinMetaData)
CALL {
  MATCH (c:Commit)

  WITH c
  LIMIT 1
  
  RETURN c.branch as main_branch
}
MATCH (run:AutomationRun)
WHERE run.name in m.ci_automation_names
AND run.head_branch <> main_branch

WITH date(datetime(run.run_started_at)) AS date, CASE run.conclusion WHEN 'failure' THEN 0 ELSE 1 END AS wasSuccess
WHERE date.weekDay <> 6 AND date.weekDay <> 7

RETURN date, (SUM(wasSuccess) * 100.0 / COUNT(*)) AS successRate
ORDER BY date

panels.description: Time To Repair Code - how long does it generally take to repair the code when an bug or a defect that impacts users occurs (e.g., bug issues)? (Ruiz et al.)

targets.cypherQuery:
MATCH (n:TwinMetaData)
WITH n.project_management_bug_categories as categories

MATCH (issue:Issue)-[r:HAS_LABEL]->(l:IssueLabel)
WHERE datetime(issue.created_at) >= datetime({epochMillis: ${__from}}) 
AND datetime(issue.created_at) <= datetime({epochMillis: ${__to}})

WITH issue, collect(l.name) as issueLabels, categories
WHERE any(category in categories WHERE size([label IN apoc.text.split(category, "&") WHERE label in issueLabels]) = size(apoc.text.split(category, "&"))) 
AND issue.state = 'closed'
AND issue.state_reason = 'completed'

RETURN avg(duration.inSeconds(datetime(issue.created_at), datetime(issue.closed_at)).seconds) as meanTimeToRecoverInSeconds

panels.title: Time To Repair Code

targets.cypherQuery:
WITH date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__from}})) AS fromDate, date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__to}})) AS toDate

WITH fromDate, toDate, duration.inDays(fromDate, toDate).days + 1 AS totalDays

UNWIND range(0, totalDays) AS daysToAdd

WITH fromDate + duration({ days: daysToAdd }) as date
WHERE date.weekDay <> 6 AND date.weekDay <> 7

MATCH (m:TwinMetaData)
OPTIONAL MATCH (r:AutomationRun) 
WHERE r.name in m.ci_automation_names
AND date(datetime(r.run_started_at)) = date

RETURN date, count(r) as runs

panels.description: For the primary application you work on, what percentage of changes requested imply a bug correction or code repair (e.g., malfunction of the application)? (Ruiz et al.)

targets.cypherQuery:
WITH date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__from}})) AS fromDate, date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__to}})) AS toDate

WITH fromDate, toDate, toInteger(duration.inDays(fromDate, toDate).days / 7) + 1 AS totalWeeks

UNWIND range(0, totalWeeks) AS weeksToAdd

MATCH (n:TwinMetaData)

WITH n.project_management_bug_categories as categories, fromDate + duration({ days: weeksToAdd * 7 }) as fromDate, fromDate + duration({ days: (weeksToAdd + 1) * 7 }) as toDate

// Exclude issues without any labels, usually irrelevant.
OPTIONAL MATCH (issue:Issue)-[r:HAS_LABEL]-(i:IssueLabel)
  WHERE date(datetime(issue.created_at)) >= fromDate AND date(datetime(issue.created_at)) <= toDate

WITH fromDate, toDate, count(issue) as overallOpened, categories

CALL {
WITH fromDate, toDate, categories

OPTIONAL MATCH (issue:Issue)-[r:HAS_LABEL]->(l:IssueLabel)
  WHERE date(datetime(issue.created_at)) >= fromDate AND date(datetime(issue.created_at)) <= toDate

WITH collect(l.name) as issueLabels, categories
  WHERE any(category in categories WHERE size([label IN apoc.text.split(category, "&") WHERE label in issueLabels]) = size(apoc.text.split(category, "&")))

RETURN count(*) as bugIssuesOpened
}

RETURN fromDate,
       CASE
         WHEN overallOpened = 0 THEN bugIssuesOpened
         ELSE 100 * bugIssuesOpened / overallOpened
         END AS bugIssueRate

panels.title: Bug Issue Rate (per week)

panels.description: For the primary application you work on, what percentage of changes requested imply a bug correction or code repair (e.g., malfunction of the application)? (Ruiz et al.)

targets.cypherQuery:
WITH date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__from}})) AS fromDate, date(datetime({epochMillis: ${__to}})) AS toDate

WITH fromDate, toDate, toInteger(duration.inDays(fromDate, toDate).days / 7) + 1 AS totalWeeks

UNWIND range(0, totalWeeks) AS weeksToAdd

MATCH (n:TwinMetaData)

WITH n.project_management_bug_categories as categories, fromDate + duration({ days: weeksToAdd * 7 }) as fromDate, fromDate + duration({ days: (weeksToAdd + 1) * 7 }) as toDate

// Exclude issues without any labels, usually irrelevant.
OPTIONAL MATCH (issue:Issue)-[r:HAS_LABEL]-(i:IssueLabel)
  WHERE date(datetime(issue.created_at)) >= fromDate AND date(datetime(issue.created_at)) <= toDate

WITH fromDate, toDate, count(issue) as overallOpened, categories

CALL {
WITH fromDate, toDate, categories

OPTIONAL MATCH (issue:Issue)-[r:HAS_LABEL]->(l:IssueLabel)
  WHERE date(datetime(issue.created_at)) >= fromDate AND date(datetime(issue.created_at)) <= toDate

WITH collect(l.name) as issueLabels, categories
  WHERE any(category in categories WHERE size([label IN apoc.text.split(category, "&") WHERE label in issueLabels]) = size(apoc.text.split(category, "&")))

RETURN count(*) as bugIssuesOpened
}

RETURN fromDate, bugIssuesOpened, overallOpened

panels.title: Opened Bugs vs All Opened Issues (weekly)
